page.title: 14EAST LINTON GALA WEEK
page.content: For about 40 years the village has had a Gala Week, usually in June. On the first day the Gala Queen, a primary 7 girl, with her attendants, is driven through the village on a decorated lorry. The parade, led by a pipe band, also includes lorries decorated by local groups and clubs, and children in fancy dress. Many people come to watch the crowning ceremony in the park. There are also contests for Knobbly Knees and Bonnie Babies, stalls with games, Scottish Dancing and children's races. To remind the Gala Queen of her special day, she helps to plant a tree in the garden of her home. During Gala Week there are football and netball competitions, treasure hunts,art displays, a disco for children and an adults' dance. Gala Week is fun for everyone.
